result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas E. Mains was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas E. Mains in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Nicholas E. Mains in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-282, 14CF- 330, 15CF-342 and 14CM-376.

3:40 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Knaapen states the plea agreement

14CM-376: Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Obstruction charge dismissed. Defense free to argue.

14CF-330: Defendant pleading to charge as set forth in information. Defense free to argue.

15CF-342 - Defendant will be pleading to Count 1. Defense free to argue.
Defendant will be pleading to Count 2. Defense free to argue.
Defendant will plead to Count 3. Defense free to argue.
Count 4 and Count 5 dismissed and read in

15CF-282 would be dismissed and read in
Cash bond was posted and is to be applied to fine and costs in other cases

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM-376: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-330: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-342: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-342: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-342: Count 3: NO CONTEST


Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant as to felony charges such as deportation, firearms and voting.

Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CM-376: Count 1: Found Guilty
14CM-376: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-330: Found Guilty
15CF-342: Count 1: Found Guilty
15CF-342: Count 2: Found Guilty
15CF-342: Count 3: Found Guilty
15CF-342: Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-342: Count 5: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-282: Dismissed and Read In 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
14CM-376:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 20 days
Pay a fine of $200 plus costs

14CF-330:
Jail sentence of 5 months consecutive to 14CM-376
52 days jail credit
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay court costs

15CF-342:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 10 days consecutive to 14CM-376 and 14CF-330
130 Days Jail Credit (time served sentence in this case)
Pay a fine and costs, totaling $1,492.00
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Drivers License Revoked 13 Months
IID will be held open for now, for the Court to review the law. Court will determine this as quickly as possible. If there are any issues, parties may be heard.
DOT Assessment and comply with any recommendations of safety plan

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 30 days consecutive to Count 1, 14CM-376 and 14CF-330
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 90  days, consecutive to Count 1, Count 2, 14CM-376 and 14CF-330
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge

15CF-282: (dismissed and read in)
30 Days Jail Credit, may be used against  14CF-330 
Cash bond of $400 in this case is to be applied to fine/costs in the other cases

Defendant Nicholas E. Mains in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Nicholas E. Mains in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:02 AM Court calls case.

Matter is on the calendar for an arraignment at this time.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Drengler is appearing on behalf of Atty Renc at this time.

Atty Drengler received a copy of the information, waives reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Court enters NOT GUILTY pleas.

State requests that bond be continued.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, will defer any bond discussion to the next court date.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

3:03 p.m. Defendant Nicholas E. Mains in court with attorney Drengler for  Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas E. Mains appeared by video. Attorney Acalia Halverson in court appearing for Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

DA #15PT1618
d.o.b. 07-12-87

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jump-felony, OWI 2nd.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. Defendant states he has Atty Renc on his other open cases.
State requests a $5,000.00 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
Defendant requests wage assignment. Express employer.
